answers.answer: it depends on what the specific counts that are elevated are.  it could be fatty liver
What is the cause off fatty liver?
high cholesterol, diabetes or overweight are generally the causes
That's the thing. I been tested for them and I'm clear... And I'm not overweight...
which is the specific liver count that was high?

Hi, sorry for the delay! I found out its the gamma thing? The one where it says its working harder and asked me whether I had a drink the night before. My last drink was new yrs eve and all I had was a half bottle of smirnoff ice and the time before that was 2yrs before that... I got a scan on the 18th, do u have any idea what may be doing this?
GGTP is a very sensitive, nonspecific liver test that many of use do not even look at.  I wouldnt worry too much if this is the only thing that is elevated.

question: Hi, I couldn't find the right forum for my questions but basically I went to my docs on friday as I had acid reflux (I get the attacks every fortnight) and I couldn't breath and was crying in pain. They sent me to hospital to be seen by the gp support unit and had bloods taken. Everything came back clear except my liver count is high. I been sent back to my gp and he is sending me for a ultra sound scan. I do not drink (my last drink was over a year ago) and I don't use drugs. I'm not on any medications but do suffer with migraines where I'm left paralysed temp in my left side and face drops and speech slurs and eye sights goes. Do u have any ideas what it can be as I am worried as I'm a young mum of 3 children who depends on me.Thank you, sj
title: 23 yr old woman with high blood count on liver
